history.content: I would not advise waiting if you are serious about trying to get into the class. Budget constraints and increased demand for the class will likely limit our ability to admit everyone again this semester.  Of course, many summers this class is offered so if you don't get in any other way, that may be an option for you.

I'm currently a declared CS major and possibly thinking of adding CS 170 during the adjustment period. According to BerkeleyTime, pre-covid semesters seemed to expand to take in all students off the waitlist. But after having seen FA20 and SP21 trends, it seems like most people didn't get off the waitlist during adjustment. I'm wondering if it's still safe to add 170 during adjustment this semester (i.e. will it expand to take everyone off the waitlist), or is it best to add during phase 2?
history.subject: CS 170 Adjustment Period
